sentence.Network_en: Out of deference to him, I lowered my head as he prayed.
sentence.Network_cn: 出于对他的敬重，在他祈祷时我低下了头。

sentence.Network_en: The old sense of deference and restraint in royal reporting has vanished.
sentence.Network_cn: 在对皇室进行的新闻报道中，那种由来已久的尊重和收敛意识已经消失了。

sentence.Network_en: He touched his forelock in mock deference.

jx.jx_en_mean: out of respect for; in consideration of

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French déférence, from déférer 'refer' (see defer)

entry.tran: （尤指对位重者的）敬重，尊敬，遵从
entry.def: Deference is a polite and respectful attitude towards someone, especially because they have an important position.

example.ex: The old sense of deference and restraint in royal reporting has vanished...
example.tran: 在对皇室进行的新闻报道中，那种由来已久的尊重和收敛意识已经消失了。

example.ex: Out of deference to him, I lowered my head as he prayed.
example.tran: 出于对他的敬重，在他祈祷时我低下了头。

means.word_mean: 1. a courteous expression (by word or deed) of esteem or regard;

sentences.sentence: "his deference to her wishes was very flattering"
"be sure to give my respects to the dean"

means.word_mean: 3. a disposition or tendency to yield to the will of others

auth_sentence.content: Is it generational change and the death of deference?
auth_sentence.res_content: Is it generational change and the death of deference?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Is it generational change and the death of deference?

auth_sentence.content: Deference didn't make an appearance on our agenda.
auth_sentence.res_content: Deference didn't make an appearance on our agenda.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Deference didn't make an appearance on our agenda.

auth_sentence.content: But deference is an uneasy posture for journalists.
auth_sentence.res_content: But deference is an uneasy posture for journalists.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But deference is an uneasy posture for journalists.
